THE VAN LOST ALL POWER WHILE TRAVELING AT 65+ MPH ON AN INTERSTATE HIGHWAY.  THIS OCCURRED SUDDENLY WITH NO WARNING AFTER THE VAN HIT A SLIGHT BUMP IN THE ROAD.  AFTER PUTTING THE VEHICLE IN NEUTRAL AND COASTING TO A STOP ON THE SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY, THE VAN WAS RESTARTED AND DRIVEN TO A DEALERSHIP.  THE DEALERSHIP RAN A COMPUTER DIAGNOSTIC THAT FOUND NO PROBLEMS (SINCE THE VAN LOST ALL POWER NOTHING WAS REGISTERED IN THE ONBOARD COMPUTER MEMORY).  WE GOT BACK ON THE ROAD AND 1.5 HOURS LATER THE SAME THING HAPPENED.  THIS TIME IT WAS AT NIGHT, ON AN EXTENDED SECTION OF INTERSTATE WITH NO SHOULDER.  WE WERE LUCKY THAT NO ONE WAS FOLLOWING CLOSELY BEHIND.  AGAIN, AFTER PLACING THE VAN IN NEUTRAL AND COASTING TO A STOP, THE VAN WAS RESTARTED AND DRIVEN TO A MOTEL.  THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED AT A SERVICE STATION, THE MECHANIC SAID HE HAD SEEN A SIMILAR PROBLEM ON 6-8 + VANS OVER THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS.  THOUGH NO DIFFINITIVE DIAGNOSTIC COULD BE RUN TO DETECT A SHORT CIRCUIT IN THE ELECTRIC FUEL PUMP, THE PUMP WAS REPLACED AND NO FURTHER PROBLEMS OCCURRED.  FAILURE OF THE FUEL PUMP AND LOSS OF ALL POWER IS A SERIOUS MALFUNCTION AT HIGH SPEEDS.  I QUESTION WHETHER THE PROBLEM IS MORE WIDESPREAD AND INDICATIVE OF A DEFECT IN DESIGN OR MANUFACTURE.
TWO DAYS AFTER PURCHASE THIS TRANSMISSION FAILED AND ALMOST CAUSED HUGE ACCIDENT ON BUSY STREET.

THE TRANSMISSION SLIPS AT STARTING AND AFTER STOPS IS SLOW TO RE-ENGAGE,  THE RADIO FOR A LONG TIME HAS SHUT OFF ON ITS OWN AND THEN WHEN YOU TRY TO TURN IT BACK ON SOMETIMES IT TAKES 20 TO 30 TRIES TO TURN IT BACK ON.  THE TRANSMISSION AND RADIO PROBLEMS ARE THE SAME AS A VAN OWNED BY MY WIFE'S BROTHER.

KEPT TRAVELING TO NEXT DESTINATION WHICH WAS GOING TO BE IN NEW MEXICO AND HIGHSPEED STALLING ACCURED AGAIN BETWEEN PHOENIX AND FLAGSTAFF.RETURNED TO PHOENIX AND WENT TO  PLYMOUTH DEALERSHIP { PETRE DEALERSHIP}.THEY RAN SEVERAL TESTS AND THOUGHT IT WAS THE O2 SENSOR AND DIRTY THROTTLE PLATES. 480$  LATER BACK  ON ROAD HEADING FOR FLAGSTAFF AZ. I PREVIOUSLY SUBMITTED A HARD COPY OF THE ORIGINAL FAILURE (NHTSA REFERENCE NUMBER 828479) VIA NORMAL MAIL.  THIS SUBMISSION IS TO DOCUMENT A SIMILAR SAFETY ISSUE THAT OCCURRED 7 WEEKS AFTER THE ORIGINAL PROBLEM WAS 'FIXED'.  I WILL REPEAT THE INFORMATION FROM MY ORIGINAL SUBMISSION FOR REFERENCE.    ORIGINAL SUBMISSION (10/22/98):  I HAD A RECALL PERFORMED ON THE ABS SYSTEM IN 1996.  AT THAT TIME, I WAS UNDER THE IMPRESSION THAT A DEFECTIVE DESIGNED PART WAS BEING REPLACED WITH A NEWER DESIGNED PART AND THAT THE ABS SYSTEM WOULD NOW FUNCTION PROPERLY.  IN AUGUST OF 1998, WHILE DRIVING DOWN A ROAD AT 35 MPH, I ATTEMPTED TO BRAKE AND HAD NO BRAKES AT ALL.  FORTUNATELY, NO ACCIDENT OCCURRED.  I TOOK THE VEHICLE TO SPARTAN CHRYSLER PLYMOUTH IN MURRAY, UT WHO INFORMED ME THE ABS HYDRAULIC SYSTEM 'PISTON ASSEMBLY' HAD FAILED.  THEY INDICATED THAT THIS WAS THE SAME PART FOR WHICH THE RECALL WAS ISSUED IN 1996.  THEY TOLD ME (IN 1998) THAT IN 1996 THE RECALL ONLY CONSISTED OF CHECKING THE PART TO SEE IF IT WAS BAD.  MY QUESTION IS THAT I WONDER IF THE RECALL WAS REALLY JUST TO CHECK THE PART?  THIS SEEMS LIKE A SERIOUS SAFETY PROBLEM.  THE PART CAN WORK TODAY AND PASS THE RECALL 'TEST' ONLY TO FAIL TOMORROW AND CAUSE INJURY OR DEATH BECAUSE THE VEHICLE LOSES THE BRAKING SYSTEM.  WOULDN'T IT BE SAFER TO REMOVE THE FAULY DESIGNED PART AND REPLACE IT WITH A KNOWN FIXED PART?    UPDATE (11/18/98)  ON 7 NOVEMBER, THE BRAKING SYSTEM OF MY VEHICLE FAILED WITH IDENTICAL SYMPTOMS AS BEFORE.  WITHOUT WARNING, THERE WAS NO BRAKING SYSTEM IN THE VEHICLE.  AGAIN, WE WERE FORTUNATE TO NOT CAUSE AND ACCIDENT.  I RETURNED THE VEHICLE TO THE SAME SPARTAN DEALERSHIP.  THIS TIME THEY DIAGNOSED THE PROBLEM AS A FAILED 'ACCUMULATOR PUMP' IN THE ABS SYSTEM.  THEY INSIST THE TWO FAILURES (2 MONTHS APART) ARE TOTALLY UNRELATED, THAT THERE IS NO HISTORY OF ABS FAILURES IN THIS MODEL OF VAN, AND THAT THERE IS NO UNDERLYING PROBLEM WHICH IS CAUSING THESE PARTS TO FAIL.
